picks.text: The M1 MacBook Air is not for sale at the end of 2025
picks.full-pick-text: The M1 MacBook Air is not for sale at the end of 2025
picks.notes: • Wal-Mart selling the M1 counted for it still being "on sale" moments before this, so one would assume they must stop selling it in 2025.

picks.text: Mac Studio is updated with a new chip
picks.full-pick-text: Mac Studio is updated with a new chip
picks.notes: • The first ever bonus pick, thanks to a pick coming true after it was graded false. Before the hosts remembered that bonus picks were a thing now, this was a Flexie.

picks.text: Apple announces a new standalone "Siri app" based on a new LLM that will...
picks.full-pick-text: Apple announces a new standalone "Siri app" based on a new LLM that will be multilingual and support multiple languages at the same time, support multiple modalities – e.g. text input, voice input, and image attachments in the same conversation, and display content from third-party apps inline based on a new developer framework.
picks.notes:
• "Be multilingual and support multiple languages at the same time."
  • "Support multiple modalities – e.g. text input, voice input, or image attachments in the same conversation."
  • "Display content from third-party apps inline based on a new developer framework."
  • If the overall pick about a "Siri app" is wrong, all the details will be counted as wrong as well. But that won't be a problem because Federico thinks that this approach is "so obvious".

picks.text: Apple introduces a new smart home product that features a screen...
picks.full-pick-text: Apple introduces a new smart home product that features a screen. It will be in the HomePod line of products, it will feature eye/hand tracking as a way to control the interface without needing to touch the screen, and it will feature support for third party apps to run on the device.
picks.notes:
• "It will be in the HomePod line of products."
  • "It will feature eye or hand tracking as a way to control the interface without needing to touch the screen."
  • "And it will feature support for third party apps to run on the device."
  • Apps may not necessarily come from a dedicated App Store, it may be more like CarPlay or some form of mirroring. Just widgets or Live Activities will not count, there has to be UI that you interact with.

picks.text: Apple replaces the "Plus" iPhone with an all new model...
picks.full-pick-text: Apple replaces the "Plus" iPhone with an all new model. It's the thinnest iPhone ever, but is made of titanium to remain strong. It has no Camera Control and/or Action Button. It does not offer an always-on display.
picks.notes:
• "It's the thinnest iPhone ever, but is made of titanium to remain strong."
  • "It has no Camera Control and/or Action Button."
  • "It does not offer an always-on display."
